Many tnarfks for your letter of April 3 in support of
S. 1160, a bill which would extend and expand the program of
grants for construction of noncommercial educational radio and
television facilities.
The importance of educational radio and its substantial
contributions to the communities it serves are most effectively
delineated in your letter and enclosure. For that reason, I
am referring both to the Senate Commerce Committee which has
scheduled hearings on S. 1160 April 11 through 14 with testimony
from James Killian, Chairman of the Carnegie Commission on Educa¬
tional Television, and other experts.
A bill has been introduced in the House on this subject,
H. R. 6736, copy enclosed, and is pending in the House Inter¬
state and Foreign Commerce Committee.
I appreciate your writing to me in this regard and
hope you will continue to let me know about matters of your concern.
Sincerely
Wm. J. Randall
Member of Congress
